review:
My therapist recommended this to help calm my anxious mind at bedtime. I blew it off at first, because I‚Äôm not a meditation person. I‚Äôve never been able to do it. 
One night, During a particularly bad bout of restlessness, i downloaded Pzizz out of desperation for sleep. At first it felt cheesy, but I figured it was harmless at worst. Surprise, surprise... I was out within 15 minutes. I tried again the next night, thinking it must have been a fluke. Same thing. Asleep within 15 minutes. 

I used to lay in bed awake for hours. This app helps me get comfortable, then gives me something to focus on that isn‚Äôt my extensive to-do list for the next day. 
I can not recommend it enough. I even pay for the full version, and I‚Äôm cheap. It‚Äôs the least I can do for how much easier they‚Äôve made bed time! I also profusely thanked my therapist.
title: Wow.
developerResponse: {'id': 17705081, 'body': "Thank you! And that's really great to hear, we're so happy Pzizz is proving helpful to you :)", 'modified': '2020-09-05T07:24:20Z'}

review: I struggle to go through Depression, Anxiety, and also ADHD, It appears that this app, is the most fitting and best app I have EVER downloaded! It's extremely hard to go through all these symptoms and on top of that, I can't even sleep at night and then, BAM! Now I can sleep extremely better at dusk, or Night. Thank you so much for making this app, I am sure you worked hard on this app because it is very nice! I hope you have a blessed day or night! Also, for the few people who have examined this Survey, if you are going to write a Review, smash 5-Stars on there and write a good review and I hope you a good night's sleep everyone! Thanks for reading this! Bye-Bye!
title: The Best App Ever!!
developerResponse: {'id': 14454209, 'body': "Wow, thank you! That's really encouraging to hear, and we're happy you're finding Pzizz helpful :) ", 'modified': '2020-04-04T11:21:31Z'}

review: I was pinged to renew my annual subscription and decided against it. I‚Äôve had Pzizz for almost 12-months. The stories are interesting and I enjoy the majority I have heard. However the ‚Äúmusic‚Äù selection one can choose to pair with the story is often macabre sounding to me. Not all of it, but I find it to be monotone, synthetic random sounds. Hard for me to explain but If there were soft instrumental music and / or a selection of nature noises w/ music to add to keep playing after the story, I would have renewed. There are other sleep apps which offer this, and are actually less expensive. They also offer endless stories‚Ä¶I hope you consider this in the future for those who prefer different ‚Äúmusic‚Äù.
title: Not for Me

review:
I love this app! Makes a huge difference in being able to fall asleep in spite of sleep disturbances issues caused by migraines, depression, and chronic pain. I‚Äôve subscribed for two or three years now on a fixed income, I enjoy the nap and focus functions that much. I would nearly recommend this app to everyone!

Only downside I‚Äôve found is that the app keeps lots of narration and music files. Most of a gigabyte may not seem like a lot on a new phone, but I‚Äôve an iPhone SE. It fills up fast.
title: Life changing, but app takes up space
developerResponse: {'id': 15824676, 'body': "Thank you! We're glad to hear you're finding Pzizz helpful.\n\nWe understand the concern, and are actually in the process of releasing a completely new app with a new download mechanism, which will allow you to manage the storage that's used by the app. It's currently in Beta and should be coming to the public soon :) ", 'modified': '2020-06-07T11:11:18Z'}

review:
I‚Äôm honestly not one to write reviews often.  This is a rare exception.

I suffered many years of sleep issues and insomnia.  I found ways to manage it, eventually, using cognitive tricks, which worked, but I needed to go to bed early every night to avoid anxiety and stress and to ensure I got enough sleep.

I tried Pzizz to focus at work and also later as a gimmick to go back to sleep in the middle of the night when I awoke.  To my surprise, I slept faster and deeper and awoke far more refreshed.

Fast forward a month and I gave up my cognitive tricks because this app works.  I am far more relaxed about sleep at night and feel fresh every morning, only using the app when I wake up and can‚Äôt sleep.  I get back to sleep and wake up fresh enough every day, and I don‚Äôt stress.

Wish this app was around years ago, and am grateful for it now.  It just works.  Thank you.
title: Bye, sleep anxiety
developerResponse: {'id': 19892511, 'body': "That's really encouraging to read, thank you for sharing. We're really happy to hear Pzizz is proving helpful for you, and hope it continues to do so :)\n\nHappy pzizzing!", 'modified': '2020-12-21T07:22:09Z'}

review: I have been using Pzizz for over a decade, it has been hands down my #1 favorite app until now. The sad reality of subscription apps is now realized on Pzizz. The familiar friend that was my meditation app has been completely nerfed in the interest of progress. Gone are the familiar apps and voices that were helping me manage stress before and during Covid-19. I can‚Äôt blame the developers, this is simply how things work now. Too bad they couldn‚Äôt simply release a new app, they just ruined the one I loved instead. RIP Pzizz!
title: 5.0 nerfed my favorite app
developerResponse: {'id': 16769806, 'body': 'All of the voices, narrations, and soundscapes that were in the previous version of Pzizz continue to be in the new version. Tap the settings button and you\'ll find the ability to switch content. You\'re probably referring to "Classic Pzizz" with the voice "Michael" as the one you like. Email us at support@pzizz.com if you have further questions, and we\'ll be happy to help you out.', 'modified': '2020-07-21T06:43:36Z'}

review:
Obviously a lot of people love this app.  I‚Äôd recommend that you test it out for yourself with a shorter subscription first. The sleeping piece uses hypnotic inductions, which for some reason rub me the wrong way and end up waking me up. Gave it a number of tries, decided I‚Äôve had enough.

The music they have for focus does help me focus. But in spite of using AI for variety, I find all the songs sounding pretty much the same. So it‚Äôs gotten old for me.
title: Not for everyone
developerResponse: {'id': 15824705, 'body': "Thank you for the honest review, and we're sorry to hear you didn't find Pzizz so helpful. But thanks for giving it a try! ", 'modified': '2020-06-07T11:14:49Z'}

review: Not a fan of the sleep section but the Focus music is fantastic. I am so incredibly ADD and cannot have any outside noises when attempting to focus. I needed a way to crack down for law school exams and this put me in a world of focus I didn‚Äôt know I could achieve. Can‚Äôt imagine reading or studying without it now. Wish the monthly option was cheaper, but definitely recommend this app and paying for Focus!!!!! At least do the free trial!

review: Pzizz is an amazing app and has helped me better sleep. I have been suffering from insomnia for my whole life. I do recommend this app for anyone that has been trying to sleep but can‚Äôt. It had helped me a lot. Thank you for reading my review, I really hope the developers see this and correct the problem.

review:
I use this app for untimed stretches of focus, using 2-4 of the available options. I don't use it for sleeping or napping. Also: Stop referencing the JK Rowling recommendation. If you had any decent competition in the wordless/repeating ambient sound category, I would have already switched rather than in anyway endorse her hateful views.

It was a five star app when it was loud enough to hear comfortably, but I can't rate it that highly now.

review:
I used to love this app; I mean seriously loved it. I recommended it to several others and I have never done that with ANY app for anything.  But now.....The new interface is clunky. The list format for the narrations was much easier to scroll through than the random size & placement of the large icons. My eye doesn‚Äôt know where to look on this layout. I still can‚Äôt figure out how to add a favorite. And what is the difference between favoriting something or starring it? No helpful written instructions as to navigating the new -fangled controls. And with that one previous statement I‚Äôve revealed myself to be a dreaded boomer. So be it. Lol 
The narrations (as far as the ones I‚Äôve listened to to date)now focus too much on breathing. They all feel like meditation sessions. The focus before was more on mentally relaxing you and letting go. 
One change I do like is the ability to delete the narrations that don‚Äôt work for you, thus clearing up storage space. 
But the real deal breaker is the new male voice narrator. He sounds like a stage actor. In fact, somewhere my brain is telling me I‚Äôve heard this guy before. And for entertainment purposes I‚Äôm sure it works very well. But your previous gentleman had a voice like liquid butter. Soothing and well modulated. This new fellow is somewhat gravelly & much too basso. Enunciation of consonants are too hard and overly pronounced and his s‚Äôs too sibilant. I realize this may all be very subjective, but one likes what one likes, and I personally find it grating. If I had heard this changeover before my subscription renewal time arrived, I probably wouldn‚Äôt have renewed. 
My husband says to give it time to settle into my ear and I might like it better. I‚Äôll try, but I‚Äôm not at all certain as to the outcome. 
A pity. I know the push for new and improved is what drives commerce. But I‚Äôm old enough to have learned that the maxim of ‚Äúif it ain‚Äôt broke, don‚Äôt fix it‚Äù is often the outcome of improving things. I fear Pzizz may have fallen into that trap.
title: Not as good since update to v5
developerResponse: {'id': 16769893, 'body': 'All of the voices, narrations, and soundscapes that were in the previous version of Pzizz continue to be in the new version. Tap the settings button and you\'ll find the ability to switch content. You\'re probably referring to "Classic Pzizz" with the voice "Michael" as the one you like. Email us at support@pzizz.com if you have further questions, and we\'ll be happy to help you out.', 'modified': '2020-07-21T06:46:46Z'}

review: Why not just make a app to help people?Why do you have to pay for it.I love the app but I can‚Äôt afford it.if you want people to like it make it free.
title: Why
developerResponse: {'id': 21446787, 'body': "We wish we could, but unfortunately making an app, maintaining it and creating new content for it costs money: overheads and wages need to be paid regularly. We do offer free-to-use content and features, and run a financial assistance program for those who can't afford the full price. Shoot us an email at support@pzizz.com for more information if you're interested :)", 'modified': '2021-03-04T12:01:27Z'}

review: Updates are few and far between. Don‚Äôt pay full price!  Find a discount code and subscribe online.
title: Where are the updates?
developerResponse: {'id': 14454181, 'body': "Sorry about that. The reason we have been a bit slower on our updates is because the app was becoming too large for many users (although we have PLENTY of new content and features ready to upload). In the meantime, we've been focusing our efforts on a completely revamped Pzizz which will use an internal download mechanism, giving the user the ability to download the content they want and therefore better manage space. This version is currently in Beta testing and should be released to the public soon (if you'd like to become a tester and try out our new stuff, please hit the 'contact us' button within Pzizz and let us know). ", 'modified': '2020-04-04T11:19:12Z'}
